The Producers are seeking an experienced Company Manager to take responsibility of the daily operational and company management of the Australian production of Come From Away, commencing in Melbourne in 2019.

\xa0

This position is responsible for the logistics for and daily management of a touring company of 39 artists, production staff and musicians, as well as specialist staff and contractors. \xa0The Company Manager will be responsible for financial management of all daily operations and the management of financial expenditure and income, including input on ticketing inventory and yield management.

\xa0

The ideal candidate should have a minimum of four years proven experience in the commercial theatre or within the live entertainment industry in a senior management position. Experience in venue or company management or administration role would be an advantage.

\xa0

This is a full-time touring position supported by a deputy, and reports to the Executive Producer.

\xa0

The scope of this position includes:

\xa0

  • Acting as representation of the Producers to all parties involved with the production.
  • Supervising and executing the general and company management of the production including the supervision of all artists, musicians, production heads of department, stage management and all specialist production staff.
  • Liaising with all creative staff of the production in respect of the general management of the rehearsals, production and operation of the production.

  • Liaising with venue management, venue staff, front of house, merchandise and box office staff in the general operation of the production.

  • Processing payroll for the production’s employees.
  • Providing analysis and subsequent budget information to the Producers to enable decision-making process.

  • Coordinating publicity requirements including the arrangement of public appearances for promotional reasons, working closely with the publicity and marketing teams.
  • Consulting with the Producers, technical direction and heads of department to ensure the production’s operations are fully executed in an efficient manner, and that they are correctly documented for future reference.
  • Ensuring all health and safety requirements of the venue and production are executed and correctly documented.

\xa0

\xa0

  • Proven business experience

  • Attention to detail
  • Proven budgeting/costing and problem-solving experience
  • Proven knowledge of the relevant industrial awards is ideal
  • A team player within a small group, but also able to work autonomously
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel and excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must.

\xa0

Salary:base annual salary $98,800 + superannuation

\xa0

Commencement: Position will commence on or around 6thMay 2019 \xa0

\xa0

Applications:

\xa0

  • Written applications should be addressed to Kiaya Hacene, Executive Producer via careers@newtheatricals.com (or on linked in)
  • Applications must include acovering letter detailing professional experience and a current CV with contacts for two referees.

Due to the continued growth and success of the organization, RateMyAgent have created an exciting opportunity for a talented People and Culture lead to join a highly successful Melbourne tech start up.

We're an energetic and tech addicted company, we work hard to ensure we achieve our goals in the very competitive world of tech and are committed to making sure we celebrate along the way. We have fun with lots of team activities including cook offs, hackathons (which you'll play a big part in organising.... read on), product and market launch parties and we all take time out to celebrate with our customers once a year at our RMA awards night (post link to this years showreel).


In terms of the day to day "vibe", well...

Do you like laughing?

Hope so. At RMA, we take our work seriously but not ourselves seriously. Our people are genuine good folk, status isn't something we're hung up on, politics doesn't fly and we look to solve problems with a people first lens.

Do you like post-its?

Great, you'll see a lot of them around! We have some die-hard agile guru's in our team, continuous improvement is something that comes up EVERYDAY and in all facets of our business as part of our L&D approach.

HSEQ Advisor

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Responsible for the maintenance, improvement and record keeping of the Integrated Company Management System and Diving Safety Management System.

Audits

Safety First Culture

  • Enthusiastically promote Dive Works safety-first culture to all personnel, clients and subcontractors.

  • Foster by action and example, a sense of HSEQ awareness through all levels of the organisation.


Essential Skills and Qualifications
